name: 陳香君
objective:
1. 組合分析 2. 機率公設 3. 條件機率與獨立 4. 離散隨機變數 5. 連續隨機變數 6. 結合分佈隨機變數 7. 期望值性質 8. 極限定理 9. 模擬
1.Combinatorial Analysis 2.Axioms of Probability3.	Conditional Probability and Independence4.Discrete Random Variables5.Continuous Random Variables6.Jointly Distributed Random Variables7.Properties of Expectation 8.Limit Theorems 9.Simulation
schedule:
Week  1. Introduction to Probability; Counting Principle
Week  2. Permutations and Combinations
Week  3. Sample Spaces, Event and Axioms of Probability
Week  4. Some Propositions; Equally Likely Fundamental Events
Week  5. Conditional Probability; Bayes Formula
Week  6. Independent Events; Sequential Events
Week  7. Midterm 1; Random Variables
Week  8. Discrete random Variable,  CDF, PMF
Week  9. Expectation, Variance, and Well Known Discrete Random Variables.
Week 10. Continuous Random Variable and PDF
Week 11. Well Known Continuous random Variables
Week 12. Function of a Random Variable; Midterm 2
Week 13. Two and Multi Dimensional Random Variables
Week 14. (Expectations of) Sums of Random Variables
Week 15. Correlation and Covariance; Conditional Expectation
Week 16. Inequality, the Law of Large Numbers and Limit Theorems
Week 17. Selected Topics (Poisson Process, Markov Chain etc)
Week 18. Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1.	Homeworks + Class participation 	      20%
2.	Two Mid Terms                           25%*2=50%
3.	Final Exam.                                   30%
materials:
Textbook:
Ghahramani, “Fundamentals of Probability with Stochastic Processes,” 3rd ed., Pearson, 2005 (or PNIE edition, 2014) , or 4th ed., CRC Press, 2019.

Reference Books:
1.       S. Ross, “A First Course in Probability”, 7th ed., Pearson Prentice Hall,    2006.
2.	Leon-Garcia, “Probability and Random Processes for Electrical Engineering,” 3rd ed., Pearson, 2009.
3.	Yates and Goodman, “Probability and Stochastic Processes,” 3rd ed., John Wiley & Sons, 2015.
4.	Papoulis and Pillai, “Probability, Random Variables, and Stochastic Processes,” 4th ed., Mc-Graw-Hill, 2002.
5.	Walpole, Myers, Myers and Ye, “Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists,” 9th ed., Pearson, 2016.
